intro: Wibelia pinnata, commonly known as the yellow poplar or gopher plant, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and palmate leaves. The plant typically grows in wetland areas and is often found in marshy or swampy habitats. Its roots are used in traditional medicine, and it plays a role in supporting local wildlife. The plant is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
